Erinnerung - memory

SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.a46.memory.gui
Interface RessourceContainer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Loader
public interface RessourceContainer

This interface defines a number of multimedia resources needed to display the memory.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke

Method Summary
 java.awt.Image[] getCurrentBackgroundImages()
          returns an array of 2 background images (480 x 480) to be drawn on the FieldPanel and as hiddencard back.
 java.applet.AudioClip[] getCurrentCardAudios()
          returns an array of 36 AudioClips for one game of memory.
 java.awt.Image[] getCurrentCardImages()
          returns an array of 36 images (234 x 234) for one game of memory.
 java.awt.Image[] getExitImages()
          returns an array of 5 images (nn x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as exitButton.
 java.awt.Image[] getHelpImages()
          returns an array of 5 images (nn x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as helpButton.
 java.lang.String[][] getHelptext()
          returns a 2 dimensional array of Strings containing the help text to be drawn on the HelpPanel.
 java.awt.Image[] getHiddencardImages()
          returns an array of 7 images (74 x 74) to be shown as cardBackImages on the field.
 java.awt.Image[] getNewgameImages()
          returns an array of 5 images (nn x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as newgameButton.
 java.awt.Image[] getNumeralImages()
          returns an array of 10 images (8 x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as counter numerals.
 java.awt.Image getTrialsImage()
          returns one image to be drawn as trialscounter label on the ButtonbarPanel.
 java.awt.Image getWelcomeImage()
          returns one image (720 x 502) to be displayed while loading the others.
 

Method Detail

getWelcomeImage

public java.awt.Image getWelcomeImage()
returns one image (720 x 502) to be displayed while loading the others.

getHiddencardImages

public java.awt.Image[] getHiddencardImages()
returns an array of 7 images (74 x 74) to be shown as cardBackImages on the field.

getNewgameImages

public java.awt.Image[] getNewgameImages()
returns an array of 5 images (nn x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as newgameButton.

getHelpImages

public java.awt.Image[] getHelpImages()
returns an array of 5 images (nn x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as helpButton.

getExitImages

public java.awt.Image[] getExitImages()
returns an array of 5 images (nn x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as exitButton.

getNumeralImages

public java.awt.Image[] getNumeralImages()
returns an array of 10 images (8 x 22) to be drawn on the ButtonbarPanel as counter numerals.

getTrialsImage

public java.awt.Image getTrialsImage()
returns one image to be drawn as trialscounter label on the ButtonbarPanel.

getCurrentBackgroundImages

public java.awt.Image[] getCurrentBackgroundImages()
returns an array of 2 background images (480 x 480) to be drawn on the FieldPanel and as hiddencard back. The first image may be null.

getCurrentCardImages

public java.awt.Image[] getCurrentCardImages()
returns an array of 36 images (234 x 234) for one game of memory.

getCurrentCardAudios

public java.applet.AudioClip[] getCurrentCardAudios()
returns an array of 36 AudioClips for one game of memory.

getHelptext

public java.lang.String[][] getHelptext()
returns a 2 dimensional array of Strings containing the help text to be drawn on the HelpPanel.
